newsitem.title: PERU: Lima shrs end firm, Morococha dominates thin trade.
newsitem.headline: Lima shrs end firm, Morococha dominates thin trade.

text.p: Shares on the Lima stock exchange closed firm Wednesday as strong gains in Morococha, outweighed losses in other leading companies, brokers said.
The market was also expected to close slightly higher Thursday, they added.

Wednesday, the General Index rose 0.36 percent to 1,754.79 points, while the blue-chip Selective Index edged up 0.27 percent to 2,555.47 points, according to bolsa figures given at the market's 1330 local time/1430 EDT close.
In a total of 1,563 trades, volume was a meager 24.1 million soles ($9.1 million).

Morococha climbed 10.07 percent to 3.17 soles on strong volume of 796,000 shares. The gain came after U.S. miner Phelps Dodge bought a 27 percent stake in the Peruvian polymetallic miner, brokers said.
Another polymetallic miner, Atacocha, also saw healthy gains, climbing 4.76 percent to 1.32 soles on strong volume of 816,000 shares.
The Phelps Dodge buy "gives the mining sector a boost," said Pablo Navarro of local brokerage Fortuna. "Definitely this is the year of the miners."
Benchmark Telefonica del Peru edged down 0.47 percent to 6.38 soles in modest volume of 512,000 shares.
The country's brewery group Union de Cervecerias Peruanas Backus y Johnston SA fell 1.55 percent to 1.91 soles in volume of 360,000 shares.
